properties.Title: Precautionary Drinking Water Advisory Alert Is Being Issued By Resort Village Of Thode
properties.Summary:
Description: A Precautionary Drinking Water Advisory has been issued for the Resort Village of Thode. This advisory is for the entire community and for any individuals who may access the water system in the Resort Village of Thode. This advisory is in effect until further notice.
Expires: 2021-02-24T17:00:00-06:00

Area: Resort Village of Thode
properties.Author: SK RV of Shields and Thode

properties.Title: Snow Squall Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snow squalls may impact the area into Friday afternoon. Travel along Highway 17 between White River and Wawa may become hazardous due to heavy snow and poor visibility. Snowfall accumulations up to 10 cm are possible, although the shifting nature of the snow bands may limit accumulations. At this point, it appears that the heaviest amounts will occur south of Highway 17. The snow squalls should move east of the region by late Friday. ### Travel may be hazardous due to sudden changes in the weather. Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become difficult to navigate due to accumulating snow. Snow squall watches are issued when conditions are favourable for the formation of bands of snow that could produce intense accumulating snow or near zero visibilities. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2021-02-20T05:13:42-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-02-19T13:14:42-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3206401527.2021
Area: White River - Dubreuilville
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Weather Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Winter Weather Travel Advisory in effect for this evening. Lake effect flurries off of Lake Superior will continue to affect the region this evening. Travel along Highway 17 and Highway 651 may become difficult at times due to poor visibility in snow and local blowing snow. Additional snowfall amounts of 2 to 4 cm are possible. The snow squalls are expected to weaken near midnight. Consider postponing non-essential travel until conditions improve. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2021-02-20T13:04:15-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-02-19T21:05:15-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3251402465.2021
Area: White River - Dubreuilville
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Rain, at times heavy, is expected. A strong frontal system is forming offshore and will hit the north and central coast on Saturday evening. This stationary frontal system is expected to bring upwards of 120 to 150 mm of total rainfall to the Central Coast - coast and North Coast - coastal regions before the rain eases off Sunday evening. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2021-02-20T15:47:13-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-02-19T23:48:13-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.4031837651.2021
Area: Central Coast - coastal sections, North Coast - coastal sections
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Weather Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Winter Weather Travel Advisory in effect for tonight and Saturday. Lake effect flurries off of Georgian Bay may develop this evening and persist into Saturday. Local snowfall accumulations of 5 to 10 cm are possible by Saturday afternoon. Travel is expected to be difficult at times due to poor visibility in snow and local blowing snow. Surfaces such as highways, roads and walkways may become difficult to navigate due to accumulating snow. Consider postponing non-essential travel until conditions improve. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2021-02-20T18:04:39-00:00

properties.Title: Snow Squall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snow squalls continue tonight. Locally heavy snow squalls continue to affect the region this evening. Travel along Highway 17 between Wawa and Agawa Bay may become hazardous due to poor visibility in snow and blowing snow. Additional snowfall amounts up to 5 cm are possible. The snow squalls are expected to weaken later this evening. ### Snow squalls cause weather conditions to vary considerably; changes from clear skies to heavy snow within just a few kilometres are common. Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2021-02-20T13:30:21-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-02-19T21:31:21-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2022477024.2021
Area: Wawa - Pukaskwa Park, Agawa - Lake Superior Park
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Accumulating snow tonight and Saturday. Total snowfall: 10 to 15 cm. Locations: most of Nova Scotia, including Halifax Metro. Time span: this evening until late Saturday. Remarks: Snow has begun in southwest Nova Scotia and will spread across the province tonight, reaching Cape Breton by early Saturday morning. The snow will taper to flurries during the day Saturday over western areas and Saturday evening over eastern areas. The highest amounts of near 15 cm of snow will likely fall along the Atlantic coast and also in onshore northeasterly winds over Pictou and Antigonish counties. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NSstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NSStorm.
Expires: 2021-02-20T17:54:52-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-02-20T01:55:52-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2527781669.2021
Area: Kings County, Annapolis County, Digby County, Lunenburg County, Queens County, Shelburne County, Yarmouth County, Hants County, Colchester County - Truro and south, Halifax Metro and Halifax County West, Halifax County - east of Porters Lake, Pictou County, Guysborough County, Antigonish County, Richmond County, Sydney Metro and Cape Breton County

properties.Title: Weather Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Winter Weather Travel Advisory in effect for tonight and Saturday morning. Snow squalls off of Lake Huron are expected to develop this evening. These snow squalls may move into the region after midnight. Local snowfall accumulations up to 5 cm are possible by Saturday morning. Motorists are advised to exercise caution as snow and blowing snow will make travel difficult in some areas. Consider postponing non-essential travel until conditions improve. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.

properties.Title: Snow Squall Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snow squalls expected tonight and Saturday. Locally heavy snow squalls may develop off of Lake Huron this evening and persist into Saturday. Travel may be hazardous due to poor visibility in snow and blowing snow. Snowfall accumulations up to 15 cm are possible, though the shifting nature of the snow squall bands may limit accumulations over a given location. The snow squalls are expected to weaken Saturday morning. ### Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become difficult to navigate due to accumulating snow. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.

properties.Title: Extreme Cold Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A prolonged period of very cold wind chills is expected. Wind chills intermittently reaching -50 to minus 55 continue to affect Arctic Bay, Pond Inlet and Clyde River tonight. Conditions will moderate on Saturday for Arctic Bay and Pond Inlet and on Sunday morning for Clyde River. ### Watch for cold related symptoms: shortness of breath, chest pain, muscle pain and weakness, numbness and colour change in fingers and toes. Extreme cold warnings are issued when very cold temperatures or wind chill creates an elevated risk to health such as frost bite and hypothermia. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2021-02-20T18:06:23-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-02-20T02:07:23-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0575879299.2021
Area: Arctic Bay, Pond Inlet, Clyde River
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong southwesterly winds gusting near 90 kilometres per hour are expected beginning Saturday evening. Winds should diminish throughout the day Sunday. ### Loose objects may be tossed by the wind and cause injury or damage. Wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2021-02-20T20:12:10-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-02-20T04:13:10-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0434983040.2021
Area: Salluit
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Extreme Cold Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Extremely cold wind chills near minus 55 will return to Resolute tonight. Cooling temperatures and strengthening winds will bring wind chill values back into the minus 55 to minus 60 range overnight. Temperatures will moderate and winds will ease on Sunday. ### Extreme cold puts everyone at risk. Watch for cold related symptoms: shortness of breath, chest pain, muscle pain and weakness, numbness and colour change in fingers and toes. Extreme cold warnings are issued when very cold temperatures or wind chill creates an elevated risk to health such as frost bite and hypothermia. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2021-02-20T12:30:14-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-02-19T20:31:14-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1326657980.2021
Area: Resolute
properties.Author: Environment Canada
